Nutrition is the food that our bodies use for energy, growth, and repair. Without good nutrition, we wouldn't be able to run, jump, or even think clearly. Our bodies need different types of food to function properly. Carbohydrates, like bread and fruits, give us energy. Protein, found in foods like chicken and beans, helps build and repair our muscles. Fats, which are found in foods like nuts and oils, help keep our bodies warm and protect our organs. Fiber, which is found in foods like broccoli and whole grains, helps our bodies digest food and stay healthy. We also need vitamins and minerals, like iron and calcium, to stay healthy. Eating a balanced diet that includes a variety of these foods helps keep our bodies strong and healthy. Just like a car needs gasoline to run, our bodies need nutrition to keep us going.

Nutrition is the study of how our bodies get the nutrients they need to stay healthy. Nutrients are the substances in food that help us grow, move, and feel good. They are like building blocks for our bodies. Without the right amount of nutrients, our bodies won't work properly. Our bodies need food, water, and air to survive. Food gives us the energy we need to move around, think, and do things we enjoy. It also helps us grow and repair damaged tissues. There are three main types of nutrients: carbohydrates, proteins, and fats. Carbohydrates are found in foods like bread, fruits, and vegetables. They give us energy. Proteins are found in foods like meat, beans, and nuts. They help build and repair our bodies. Fats are found in foods like oils and nuts. They help keep our bodies warm and help us absorb vitamins. Vitamins and minerals are also important nutrients. They help our bodies work properly and keep us healthy
